title: Monica's Story - Monica Lewinsky's side of the Clinton Affair
description:
This is an abridged reading of "Monica's Story" by Andrew Morton, read by Jennifer Van Dyke.

Republicans tend to view Monica as an innocent intern taken advantage by her boss.  Democrats view Lewinsky as a tramp whose goal it was to seduce and bring down a President.  Monica Lewinsky views herself as neither.  In this book, she describes how she was a willing participant in her affair with President Clinton, and would not have divulged it, if not for perjury charges brought against her by the Ken Starr commission, after Linda Tripp provided taped phone conversation showing that Lewinsky did indeed lie about her relationship.  She has nothing but contempt for the Starr commission, but feels unjustly maligned by the White House, the people she was trying to protect.  A fascinating story.
